entry.title: sensors: Merge PlatformSensorProviderBase into PlatformSensorProvider.
entry.content:
Especially after https://crrev.com/c/1693763, there is very little

reason to keep both classes separate, and merging them makes it easier

to reason about the code.



PlatformSensorProvider was only providing a couple of static functions

and a public destructor for child classes. These can be easily moved

into PlatformSensorProviderBase without any user-visible effect.

entry.title: signinWithFakeIdentity: Support repeated signins
entry.content:
With kReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos enabled, signinWithFakeIdentity

does two things: (1) sign in via the bottom sheet, and (2) confirm the

history opt-in.

The problem was that the history opt-in only shows up during the

*first* signin - if the test signs the user out, then back in again,

the previous opt-in will still apply. That made tests fail, since the

expected opt-in button wasn't there.



This CL fixes this by checking for a pre-existing history opt-in

before looking for the opt-in button.



Bug: 1462156

entry.title: [iOS] Update syncAccountState to handle the identity being removed.
entry.content:
When the identity is removed from device, while viewing the account

settings UI, the UI crashes.



This CL fixes the logic to decide the

SyncSettingsAccountState::kSignedOut to include the external identity

removal.



By checking TransportState::PAUSED, as GetAccountInfo() will not be

emptied yet for a temporarily time.



Crash repro steps:

1- Sign in on iOS device and open the new unified settings page.

2- Sign in on desktop with the same account in 1.

3- From the desktop, using "Your devices" sign out from the iOS device.

4- The unified settings page will crash.



Fixed: 1475268

entry.title: [DBSC] Reset cookie refresh fetcher upon timeout
entry.content:
Blocked requests are resumed after 20 seconds if cookies are still

stale. This makes sure we don't hold the request for too long. In this

CL, the fetcher is reset when this timeout is hit. This allows future

requests to trigger a new cookie rotation.



If there is network loss, blocked requests are resumed immediately

without hiting the timeout. The progress made in the fetcher won't be

lost and it will resume as soon as the network is back.



Bug: b/273920907

Change-Id: I219d03ce41ec0653dd3337e085544e62b1ec0175

entry.title: gpu: win: Implement solid color overlays without IDCompositionColorMatrixEffect
entry.content:
This CL uses one DComp surface per color for solid color overlays

instead of IDCompositionColorMatrixEffect. This is useful because

IDCompositionColorMatrixEffect causes an implicit off-screen surface to

be allocated and allocating many small DComp surfaces has lower GPU

memory usage, in our case. It is needed to support complex 3D

transforms since the transform can cause the off-screen surface bounds

to not be calculated correctly in some cases.



The solid color overlays allocations are now pooled, to avoid thrashing

when there are overlays that are constantly changing color.



Change-Id: Ic3e25840dbf3a9e93961889eced40aa5fd8a4a05

similar.

entry.title: Remove subresource request blocking logic
entry.content:
Subresource request blocking logic was introduced [1] to block

subresource requests from the browser process by calling BlockRequests()

IPC. InterstitialPageImpl used this logic. But it was removed [2] after

Committed Interstitials [3] was introduced.



Currently RenderFrameHostImpl::CreateNewWindow() calls BlockRequests()

to block subresource requests when `waiting_for_init_` is true. And

RenderFrameHostImpl::Init() is calling ResumeBlockedRequests() to resume

them. But it sounds useless because navigation is also blocked until

Init() is called, and no subresource requests should be fetched. So this

CL removes this logic, and all subresource request blocking related

logic.



[1] https://crrev.com/c/1164542

[2] https://crrev.com/c/2146137

[3] https://crbug.com/755632



Bug: 581037

Change-Id: Iecab896362b54fa2b5c3fcb1eac2cd3575e29f7e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3954952

entry.title: [CVC Storage][Desktop] Make CVC save option an enum in SaveCreditCardOptions
entry.content:
When offering to save CVC, there can be 3 cases:

1. Save card without CVC (if user has opted out of CVC save)

2. Save card with CVC (if user has opted in to CVC save)

3. Save CVC to an existing card (if user has opted in to CVC save, and

an existing card without CVC saved was used for checkout after filling

CVC)



Currently, we have a boolean `cvc_save_only` in SaveCreditCardOptions

which tells us whether a card is being saved, or if the CVC is being

saved for an existing card. But, if a user has opted in to CVC save, we

want to inform them that their CVC is being saved with the card details.



Add an enum `CardSaveType` instead of this boolean to handle all the 3

cases.



Note: The description text to be shown in the case where the card is

saved with the CVC will be added as a follow-up change.



Change-Id: I14d3ecfc97df90e2493e95b5655dd4f7204fd37a

Bug: 1462821

entry.title: ozone/wayland: Send rounded corners on local surface coordinates
entry.content:
This CL lets WaylandFrameManager sends rounded corners bound on local

surface coordinates.



It continues to use `augmented_surface_set_rounded_corners_clip_bounds`,

but its behavior is updated on Exo side on Version 9 in the surface

augmenter protocol to support local surface rounded corners, so this CL

updates surface augmenter version on Lacros side to 9.

entry.title: Add focus handling to editor menu promo card focus view.
entry.content:
Add a pre target handler to EditorMenuPromoCardView so that it handles

focus in the same way as EditorMenuView when it is initially shown, i.e.



1. Clicking outside the bounds closes the view.

2. Up/Down arrows move focus from the context menu to the editor menu

promo card.

3. When the editor menu promo card is activated, the context menu is

dismissed.



When focus is initially moved onto the editor menu promo card, the

dismiss button gains focus. Then, apply default focus behaviour (so that

pressing the Tab key moves focus between the promo card buttons).

entry.title: Exo: Support rounded corners on local surface coordinates
entry.content:
This CL supports `rounded_corners_bounds` located on local surface

coordinates space instead of its root surface coordinates.



Currently, it is located on the root surface coordinates space, but it

breaks the behavior when the host window has a negative coordinates.

The bug was hidden for now since there was not a case where the host

window takes a negative coordinates, but the clip delegation introduces

such scenario.



This CL updates the behavior of set_rounded_corners_clip_bounds in

surface_augmenter protocol so it increments a version number.



This is a server side implementation of rounded corners bug fix.

This CL does not affect the behavior.

This change will be applicable when the client side implementation

will be landed.



Bug: 1470955, 1470024

entry.title: Always defer assigning RFH to navigation if a pending commit RFH exists
entry.content:
With navigation queueing, assigning a RFH for a navigation is deferred

if there is a pending commit RFH and the navigation cannot reuse the

pending commit RFH. However, this means it is not possible to enforce

invariants like "there can only be 1 pending commit navigation at a

time" (which is currently CHECKed in

RenderFrameHostImpl::RecordMetricsForBlockedGetFrameHostAttempt() but

fails in some tests when RenderDocument is enabled)).



This CL drops the exception for when the pending commit RFH could be

reused and just always defers assigning the RFH when a pending commit

RFH is present, to allow a consistent set of invariants to be

maintained during navigation.



Bug: 1220337

Change-Id: I2e819411896d749eeb0c8824fa833e388fb267c0

entry.title: Fix chrome:// URLs in ChromeOS launcher search
entry.content:
When Lacros is enabled, entering a URL via the launcher search should

open the same page as when entering it into Lacros's address bar.

This was not the case for chrome:// URLs. For example,

chrome://histograms in the launcher would actually open os://histograms.



A Tast test will follow.

entry.title: Amend calendar view focus order
entry.content:
Moves the calendar contents view and slidable surface UI up in the

calender view's focus order (before the today button). Note that with

glanceables disabled, when calendar view is stand-alone bubble, it was

sufficient to ensure that date view gets initial focus, as the focus

would cycle from the slidable surface to the today button. With

glanceables, focus would not cycle withing the calendar view - it would

move into another glanceable bubble.



BUG=b:297186532

entry.title: Refactor PrintJob creation
entry.content:
Update PrintViewManagerBase class to have a virtual function

CreatePrintJob() which only does object creation, without any other

state setup. This prepares for more cleanly supporting a derivative

test class for PrintJob without that being entangled with internal

state management of PrintViewManagerBase.



Rename CreateNewPrintJob() to SetupNewPrintJob() to better reflect

how this method does more work than just creating an object.

entry.title: Always consider divider width in tablet mode
entry.content:
This CL makes `GetDividerPosition()` always be aware of the divider

width in tablet mode.

CL:4671012 changed it to adjust the position only when

`split_view_divider_` is available but that broke the snapped bounds

for client controlled windows (e.g., ARC++).

ClientControlledState needs to know the snapped bounds before

initializing the divider (i.e., actually snapping the window) via

GetSnappedWindowBounds(), so in tablet mode we always need to adjust the

position regardless of the `split_view_divider_`’s availability (which

would be available shortly after).



BUG=b:296517595

TEST=ClientControlledStateTestClamshellAndTablet.SnapWindow

TEST=SnapGroupEntryPointArm2Test.*



Change-Id: Ic881c59d240e3a3523983e3898c3087a02ed069d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4805371

entry.content:
The buttons in the download bubble are created with callbacks with a raw

DownloadUIModel pointer bound as an argument. These pointers can dangle,

e.g. when the button is clicked, since the model is owned by the

DownloadBubbleRowView which is destroyed when the button action is run

(closing the bubble). This uses weak ptr for the model to avoid

dangling.



Bug: 1475181

entry.title: [DownloadBubble] Clear model when download is deleted
entry.content:
This nulls out the DownloadUIModel member of DownloadBubbleRowView

when the backing download is destroyed. This is to avoid calling into

a deleted DownloadItem and causing a crash.



The specific crash is due to the RepeatingTimer callbacks, but this adds

null checks everywhere the model is expected to be non-null.

entry.title: Unify IPC to enable accessibility options into 1 call.
entry.content:
Currently, even at startup, each accessibility feature is enabled

separately, meanwhile this triggers the start/shutdown of

AccessibilityHelperService in ARC. Due to the async nature of services,

there can be race condition between start and shutdown, causing

AccessibilityHelperService to not start even though a feature was

enabled

entry.title: Fix missing or delayed battery saver notifications
entry.content:
This CL fixes various issues with Battery Saver notifications.



First, by not delaying enable/disable or the notification when the

battery charge remaining is still calculating (unless we need it).



Second, by ignoring battery saver state updates from Power Manager in

BatterySaverController, since Power Manager sends spurious updates when

activating battery saver.



Third, by ignoring battery_saver_previously_active_ in

PowerNotificationController, since we don't actually need that state.



Bug: b:296330942 b:296327023 b:296330274

Test: Set display brightness to max, load webgl aquarium with max fish,

and wait for battery saver to enable. Verify that notifications are

sent. ash_unittests

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2:V4L2StatefulVD: support flush while there's pending work
entry.content:
Sometimes a flush (== a Decode() call with an end_of_stream() |buffer|)

arrives while there's pending work in |decoder_buffer_and_callbacks_|.

If we were to directly SendStopCommand(), we'd lose that pending work

(and the FlushAtEndOfStream_MultipleOutstandingDecodes test case would

fail). This CL supports this perfectly normal situation by storing such

an end_of_stream() |buffer|, and treating it later on in

TryAndEnqueueOUTPUTQueueBuffers().



This is tested via FlushAtEndOfStream_MultipleConcurrentDecodes on

trogdor.

entry.title: Fix QuotaDatabase::EnsureOpened() reentrant nested txn
entry.content:
It is possible for EnsureOpened() to be reentrant where ResetStorage()

or {EnsureDatabaseVersion() => QuotaDatabaseMigrations::UpgradeSchema()

=> ResetStorage()} calls back to EnsureOpened().



This changes EnsureDatabaseVersion() to no longer call ResetStorage(),

but to return false. EnsureOpened() will already call ResetStorage()

when either OpenDatabase() or EnsureDatabaseVersion() fails, but now

it will return immediately if ResetStorage() succeeds.



This bug was discovered when tast test

hwsec.CrossVersionChromeLogin.tmp2_r88 restores a version 5 database and

CrxInstaller is the first code path to touch QuotaDatabase and calls

Commit() with the nested transaction which causes DCHECKs to fail.



Change-Id: I622982f49d987b21d50e0c38ee86b70a6d072a53

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4805623

Reviewed-by: Evan Stade

Commit-Queue: Joel Hockey

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1187583}

entry.title: fws: Add additional metrics for success/failure
entry.content:
Add additional metrics to determine rate of success. This is done

by checking how many times we initialize fws v2 and how many times

we record a fws launch + no template found. At the moment there is

no way to determine if LaunchAppsFromTemplate has any failures

that can lead to a blocking launch, so this is the best way to

determine it at the moment.



BUG=b:297251580

TEST=FloatingWorkspaceServiceTest*

entry.title: [MappableSI] Implement ScopedMapping.
entry.content:
1. Add a new interface MapSharedImage() to SharedImageInterface

which will map the shared image mailbox to CPU visible memory so

that clients can read/write to that memory.

This call issues a blocking/sync call to service side on the

client's thread until the GpuMemoryBufferHandle and other

metadata arrives back from the service side. This info is

then cached in SharedImageInterface so avoid blocking in future.



2. Add a new class ScopedMapping which will be used to manage

map/unmap and other access to underlying native buffer or shared

memory. Implement client and service side changes for it.

entry.title: Add pre target handler for Editor Menu
entry.content:
This cl handles the events:

1. Click outside the bounds will close the view.

2. Up/Down arrows will move focus from context menu to Editor Menu.

3. When Editor Menu is activated, the context menu will be dismissed.



After the Editor Menu is active, Tab key press will move focus inside

the view.
